conditionalAction.string:
import jmri import java
class MyNceListener(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceListener): def message(self, msg): return def reply(self, msg): return
mnl = MyNceListener()
# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 0) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 19) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 19) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 38) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 38) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 57) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 57) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 76) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 76) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 95) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 95) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 114) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 114) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 133) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 133) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 152) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 152) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 171) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 171) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 190) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 190) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 209) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 209) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 228) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 228) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)

# Get the traffic controller tc = None try: tc = jmri.InstanceManager.getDefault( \ jmri.jmrix.nce.NceSystemConnectionMemo).getNceTrafficController() except: print "No Traffic Controller"
if (tc != None): if (tc.getCommandOptions() >= jmri.jmrix.nce.NceTrafficController.OPTION_2006): m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(5) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.SEND_ACC_SIG_MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 0x00) # addr_h m.setElement(2, 0x01) # addr_l m.setElement(3, 0x01) # Macro cmd m.setElement(4, 247) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
# Unfortunately, the new command doesn't tell us if the macro is # empty, so we send the old command for status. m = jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage(2) m.setElement(0, jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.MACRO_CMD) m.setElement(1, 247) # Macro # m.setBinary(True) m.setReplyLen(jmri.jmrix.nce.NceMessage.REPLY_1) tc.sendNceMessage(m, mnl)
